title: 'Serial Stowaway' was arrested at a Chicago airport after trying to sneak onto a flight
text:
Marilyn Hartman, 67, (pictured) was arrested for trying to sneak past TSA security to board a flight

An elderly woman who has sneaked on several passenger flights and is known by authorities as the 'Serial Stowaway' has been arrested after trying to sneak through airport security in Chicago.

Marilyn Hartman, 67, was taken into police custody on Friday night and charged with a felony count of criminal trespass to a registered area at an airport.

Hartman was reportedly trying to sneak through the security line by moving TSA lane dividers at the Chicago O'Hare International Airport.

She did not have a boarding pass or ID on her.

ABC News reports she was apprehended before she made it through security.

She is due in court on Sunday.

Hartman has been arrested by authorities on several occasions for trying to sneak onto planes without buying a ticket or any ID

Airports where the 'Serial Stowaway' has been caught trying to board passenger flights San Francisco International Airport Los Angeles International Airport Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport St. Paul International Airport (Minneapolis) Jacksonville International Airport Chicago O'Hare International Airport Chicago Midway International Airport

According to the Chicago Tribune, Hartman has been arrested for 20 airport incidents from 2014 to January 2018.

In February 15, 2014, Hartman was able to bypass a TSA checkpoint and board a plane to Hawaii without a ticket.

She was caught after the person whose seat she was occupying arrived.

Before her latest arrest, Hartman walked onto a flight to London from the Chicago O'Hare International Airport without a ticket.

She was caught in London, pleaded guilty and was given 18 months probation

Just two days after that, Hartman was back at the Chicago O'Hare International Airport and was taken into custody when she refused to leave the premises.

She has accumulated an impressive number of misdemeanors and felonies for her air bound joy rides.

She was subsequently banned from entering the Chicago O'Hare International Airport or the Midway airport.
description: 67-year-old Marilyn Hartman, also known as the 'Serial Stowaway' has been arrested again on Friday evening after she tried to sneak past TSA security to board a flight without a ticket or ID
